Title: CC- Severity - UK
Content:
SEVERITY: FOOD & DRINK

The below table defines the severity grading of customer Complaints related to food & drink.

High

Medium

Low

Food is raw or uncooked

Very limited choice of food on a day

Did not like the choice of food despite a variety being available

Foreign body found in food (e.g., glass, plastic, wood, insects, hair)

Very limited choice of food throughout the holiday, repetitive food

No British food available

No food available for client due to dietary requirements not being catered despite client asking for it when booking (e.g., no vegetarian option)

No signs advising what food is (e.g., nut allergies, gluten intolerant, vegetarian, kosher)

Food not enjoyed due to personal taste

Food gone off / rotten / past its sell date

Only one brand available of alcoholic beverage (all-inclusive holidays)

Having to queue to get food

Food which is meant to be hot served cold (e.g., hot food not being kept warm by hot plate but still available)

 

Alcohol beverage available, but did not like any of the brands (all-inclusive holidays)

One particular type of common beverage not available (in all-inclusive holidays, e.g., vodka, rum, lager, wine, whisky etc.)

 

 

 

SEVERITY: ROOM

The below table defines the severity grading of customer complaints related to their room.

High

Medium

Low

Room has been broken into

Other safety  concerns (e.g., safety box defective, cannot lock balconies in a high floor)

Minor cosmetic issues (e.g., holes in the wall, wallpaper damage, old paint )

Safety concerns (e.g., not being able to lock door, not being able to lock balcony in a ground floor)

Basic facilities are not working as per standard (e.g. shower head leaking, taps leaking, toilet takes time to fill up)

Basic facilities do work, but performance varies (e.g., shower changes pressure / temperature)

Infestation inside the room  (e.g., insects, rodents, lizards, bugs)

Dirty towels, mattresses, bedsheets, pillows

Room has not been cleaned thoroughly (e.g., dust on surfaces, floor not clean)

Basic facilities not working (e.g., toilets, showers)

Damaged furniture, but not impacting their use (e.g., damaged bed corners, chairs)

Did not like the decoration of the room

Severe hygiene issues (e.g., blood stains) in towels, bedsheets, mattresses, pillows etc.

 

 

Severely damaged or unusable furniture (e.g., broken beds, sofas, chairs)

 

 

Exposed electrical wires

 

 

 

SEVERITY: SERVICE

The below table defines the severity grading of customer complaints related to service.

High

Medium

Low

Been assaulted by staff  - SEND TO HLC

No staff spoke English

Maid did not speak English

Staff has stolen items from the room (e.g., maid)

Language of the entertainment was not English

Staff were grumpy / not friendly

Inappropriate entertainment

Staff were pushy to sell activities (e.g., other excursions, activities)

Staff were not helpful

 

Room was not cleaned or serviced on a daily basis

There was no one there to receive me

 

 

I could not get hold of anyone in reception

 

 

Did not like the entertainment, was not to my taste

 

SEVERITY: FACILITIES 

The below table defines the severity grading of customer complaints related to facilities. 

High

Medium

Low

Facilities are unsafe (e.g., lose wires, slippy floors, broken tiles in the swimming pool, empty glasses and bottles)

Facilities are not clean (e.g., dirty seats in restaurant, pool has minor debris in it, cutlery is dirty)

Did not like the style and the decoration of the building

 

SEVERITY: KEYS

The below table defines the severity grading of customer complaints related to Keys. 

High

Medium

Low

Facilities are in a poor state of disrepair or show clear evidence of poor upkeep (e.g., broken windows, tiles, doors, common areas)

Some restaurants are not open as advertised

Common areas are not being cleaned deeply (e.g., dusty furniture, dirty floors)

 

SEVERITY: GENERAL FACILITIES

The below table defines the severity grading of customer complaints related to General Facilities. 

High

Medium

Low

No basic facilities available (e.g., such as hot water, air conditioning (where available and advertised))

Basic facilities are available but service is erratic (e.g., water in pool is too cool, shared facilities not working as they should do, air conditioning in common areas)

Power cuts outside the control of the hotel

 

SEVERITY: HEALTH AND SAFETY

The below table defines the severity grading of customer complaints related to Health and Safety. 

High

Medium

Low

No restaurant facilities available as advertised

 

 

 

SEVERITY: GENERAL HOTEL STANDARDS

The below table defines the severity grading of customer complaints related to General Hotel Standards.

High

Medium

Low

Lack of contracted leisure facilities (tennis courts, sauna, water sports) No other facilities nearby

Lack of contracted leisure facilities (tennis courts, sauna, water sports) however alternative facilities available nearby

Contracted leisure facilities available (tennis courts, sauna, water sports) but with some disruption (sporadic)

Lack of contracted leisure facilities (tennis courts, sauna, water sports) No other facilities nearby

Lack of contracted leisure facilities (tennis courts, sauna, water sports) however alternative facilities available nearby

Contracted leisure facilities available (tennis courts, sauna, water sports) but with some disruption (sporadic)
Description: This article defines the severity levels of complaints relating to food and drink, room, service, general facilities, health & safety, hotel & services
Keywords: Compensation calculator, severity, food & drink, service, room, rep services, building work, hotel, facilities ,Complaint,Complaints

Title: CC - Impact - UK
Content:
OVERALL IMPACT - This articles defines the overall impact calculations for compensating customers.

High

Medium

Low

If the intention of the holiday has been ruined by the complaint (e.g., honeymoon due to terrible service, not being able to explore due to poor reps, not been able to have a rest due to lack of kids club, if it is all inclusive and the bar is closed)

If the complaint directly impacted the holiday in certain levels preventing the enjoyment (e.g., noise through the night preventing sleep)

If the customer had no direct impact from the complaints or impact is limited (e.g., noise throughout the day)

If the customer has been hospitalised or required medical attention due to the complaint (e.g., injury due to unsafe condition, illness due to food)

If the customer felt uncomfortable or unwell (e.g., had to stay in the room due to not agreeing with the food)

If the customer suffered no impact (e.g., saw raw food but did not eat it, saw slippery floor but did not fall)

If complaint was raised repetitively by customer to hotel and rep and it did not get resolved

The complaint was raised repetitively and got resolved after a number of days

The complaint was raised and resolved in under 24 hours (e.g., repaired appliance, food choice changed)

When complaining about food, if holiday was full board

When complaining about food, if holiday was half board

When complaining about food if holiday was Breakfast only

When an event "has" impacted and consequences remain for the whole holiday (or the whole day)

When an event "has" impacted us, but the consequences were short term, or sporadic

When an event "could have" impacted us, but ultimately did not

  

The customer cannot articulate or say how did it impact them

When dealing with Wrong Room Types -The room allocated is completely different to the one booked, Major elements which were offered in the original booking are not offered in this one, it is located in a completely different location to the original and far away from the facilities which would have been accessed from the original. There are no alternative facilities nearby the new one. This has all had a significant impact on the holiday, potentially ruining it

When dealing with Wrong Room Types - There are some difference in the room but they are overall similar, most elements which were offered in the new one are similar to the old one, It is in a similar location and alternatives facilities are close by. This has impacted the holiday to certain degree

When dealing with Wrong room Types - Room is essentially the same but has minor differences (e.g., cosmetics) , Elements offered in the room are the same (e.g., air conditioning, balcony, mini bar, TV, speakers, view etc), Same location - same access to facilities - very little or limited impact to the customer
Description: This articles defines the overall impact calculations for compensating customers.
Keywords: Compensation, impact, overall impact, compensation calculator ,Complaint
